doc.brief: Closing of a given binary image using mathematical morphology operations.
doc.long:
A closing is a mathematical morphology operation, which is the composition of a dilation and an erosion (8-connexity-based), using a square as structural element. The size (i.e. width) of the structural element should be an odd number. If it is not the case, the size is automatically rounded to the nearest superior odd number.

The result is a binary image containing the white pixels sets of the source image which match (are identical to) the structural element. In other words, it does not contain any white region smaller than the structural element.

Warning: Let s be the size of the structural element. Because of the very nature of dilation and erosion, the content of the s rows and columns contiguous to the borders of the resulting image is not relevant.

doc.brief: Full pathname of the file containing the source binary image.
doc.long: The format of the file must be one of the binary formats described by the PBM+ specification (either raw or ASCII).

doc.brief: Full pathname of the file to store the closing of the source image.
doc.long: The format of the file is raw PBM.

doc.brief: Size (i.e. width) of the square structural element used for the opening.
doc.long: The size of the structural element must be an odd number. If the supplied value is an even number, it is automatically rounded to the nearest superior odd number.
